intro: Phacomene pontina, commonly known as the Pontic phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the region of the Black Sea. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and coastal areas. It is an annual herb that thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain several seeds that are dispersed by wind.
